Description: Neck and shoulder fragment of North Ionian Late Wild Goat pottery dinos; interior reserved; exterior: from the top: maeander frieze; band of dots; pomegranate frieze with dots; upper animal frieze of birds to right (heads alternately turned back); lower frieze: head of a griffin to left; purple patches on alternate sections of birds; incision used for part of outline and for details of birds and of griffin.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Published in CVA Oxford 2, II D, p. 81, no. 55, pl. IV. According to the CVA, the registration number of the piece is 1925.608d2, but this is not clear on the sherd.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D pl. 4, 55)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.417)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
